page.title: 01Sandyhills Bay Dumfriesshire
page.content: In this block rounded hills on 'Siluman' rocks slope fairly steeply towards a cliffed coastline. Vegetation is rough moorland and heath with rocky outcrops apart from areas near the few roads. The main road follows the coast. Sandyhills villae occupie the only level low ground, where a stream reaches the sea. Here is also a Sandy beach. Popular with tourists and Dumfires residents in the summer. However there are few facilities and the trade is entirely seasonal. At Barend is a modern chalet development with licensed restaurant. The tide falls to reveal mudlats extnding severall miles out to sea, and the coast is teacherous. At the eastern end of the block is an area of marshy wetland which forms Southwick coast National Nature Reserve. Perm Population is small.
